XenotypeDef.label: baseloc
XenotypeDef.description: Once a niche product of Melan Inc. on a faraway Rimworld, the Baseloc are now spread across the rim as a less popular alternative to the Baseliner, and the gateway to a new set line of Baseloc spinoffs, collectively known as Lox, developed by Melan Inc. outposts all over the rim. today, outside of sprawling Urbworlds where they continue to proliferate, Baseloc have found themselves as either the minority in more mixed colonies or as the dominant influence in factions populated by other Melan Inc. creations.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: A legacy product of Melan Inc., now the start of a new line of Loc-based xenotypes and forms

XenotypeDef.label: wildlox
XenotypeDef.description: Noting the difficulty of obtaining meat and animal products on some further and more hostile Rim worlds, a xenotype was planned to improve the general chances of successful Rim world colonies, as well as the demand for wider Melan Inc. xeno products. Utilizing a blend of preexisting animal traits as well as a captured gene mix from other xenos, the Wildlox is naturally capable of the most difficult of animal handling tasks, and can coax other animals to help them temporarily. \n\n The mix of other genes allows them to not only produce certain animal products, but it also improves their sight and accuracy greately as well as ridding them of parts of their modesty.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: Known for their phenomenal animal handling skills and their lack of modesty, Wildlox are most commonly found in handling roles across the rim and in some cases will even unify with other similar Xenos.

XenotypeDef.label: pawloc
XenotypeDef.description: Following the use of Highmates and their variants as companions on worlds across the rim, and their use as empire supported concubines, the Pawloc was engineered by a spinoff Melan outpost to have the appeal of the Highmate without the drawback of forming a single and sustained psychic bond as an experiment to attempt the creation of a high value and high status xeno. The removal of their psychic bond however lead to this xenotype becoming incredibly aggressive and violent. \n\nDespite their combat utility, they more often and more frequently appear as part of other Lok communities, though they can also wind up in more aggressive and violent factions.
XenotypeDef.descriptionShort: The Pawloc was the first attempt in creating what ended up as the Headlox, and has turned it's defining failure and weakness into a strength on more violent parts of the rim.
